title: Red Sox will keep Roman Anthony in leadoff spot for 2026 season. What could rest of lineup look like?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Roman Anthony will lead off for the Red Sox in the 2026 season, manager Alex Cora announced.
Anthony had a .396 on-base percentage in 2025, performing well as a leadoff hitter despite limited at-bats.
Manager Alex Cora confirmed Willson Contreras will bat cleanup, with speculation about the rest of the lineup positions.

title: Margo Price talks AI, bro-country and meeting Joan Baez at the circus
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Margo Price discusses inspirations, including Joan Baez, ahead of her Boston show on February 21 at The Royale.
Price cites her Grammy-nominated album 'Hard Headed Woman' as a defiant statement against the mainstream country music industry's norms.
Price's husband, Jeremy Ivey, has deep ties to Massachusetts, including a period of homelessness in Boston in his youth.

title: She’s running Boston so children like her daughter get access to healthcare
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Jordan Whitaker, from Deering, NH, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon for Mass. Eye and Ear.
Whitaker's 8-year-old daughter received care at Mass. Eye and Ear for infected cysts causing severe sleep apnea.
Her participation aims to support access to healthcare for children with similar medical needs.

title: A.J. Brown’s Eagles teammate doesn’t buy Patriots trade possibility
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: A.J. Brown denies interest in Patriots trade, stating he's just trolling after podcast comments with Julian Edelman and Rob Gronkowski.
Eagles RB Saquon Barkley attributed Brown's Patriots comments to his fandom, describing the wink as 'fun and games'.
Despite rumors, A.J. Brown reportedly requested trades from Eagles and NFL insider views Patriots as a fitting trade partner.

title: Here’s what Boston meteorologists are saying about the timing and impacts of the Sunday-Monday nor’easter
author: John Waller
bullets: Boston's Sunday-Monday nor'easter expected to bring 10 to 20 inches of snow to eastern Massachusetts and Rhode Island.
Blizzard conditions likely from midnight to midday Monday with high winds and potential coastal flooding in eastern Massachusetts.
Forecasters predict power outages and significant travel disruptions; storm impacts may extend into Tuesday.

title: Alex Bregman declines to respond to Sam Kennedy’s comments about player’s Red Sox departure
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Bregman refused to comment on Red Sox president Sam Kennedy's claim that he chose to leave Boston.
Sam Kennedy implied that if Bregman wanted to stay with the Red Sox, he would have, focusing on lacking a no-trade clause.
Bregman signed with the Chicago Cubs, emphasizing it wasn't only due to the no-trade clause absence in Boston's offer.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Apocalypse Now' starring Robert Duvall is streaming on Pluto TV and Plex.
'Blue Moon' directed by Richard Linklater is available on Netflix.
'The Last Thing He Told Me' Season 2 is streaming on Apple TV with Jennifer Garner.

title: Red Sox INF Marcelo Mayer has to earn spot on Opening Day roster, Alex Cora says
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora says Marcelo Mayer must earn his spot on the Opening Day roster.
Mayer needs to improve offensively, after batting .228 in 44 games with four home runs last season.
Injuries shortened Mayer's past seasons, but he enters 2026 spring training healthy and versatile for infield roles.

title: 7 maps predicting snowfall totals Sunday-Monday
author: John Waller
bullets: A major winter storm is expected to bring 10 to 20 inches of snow to eastern Massachusetts and Rhode Island.
Blizzard conditions and potential power outages are predicted from late Sunday into Monday due to heavy wet snow and strong winds.
Uncertainty remains about snowfall amounts in western Massachusetts and Connecticut as the storm develops.

title: Lindsay Clancy appears in court for first in-person hearing since allegedly killing her children
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Lindsay Clancy appeared in person at Plymouth Superior Court, using a wheelchair, for her first hearing since 2023.
Clancy faces charges of murder and strangulation for allegedly killing her three children in Duxbury on Jan. 24, 2023.
Clancy's defense argues she was suffering from postpartum mental illness and intends to pursue an insanity defense in July trial.
